body:
I just deleted about 1,000 emails and aaaaaall the way at the bottom from 2012 I found emails from Gemsir when I was supposed to edit all of the even chapters (someone else was supposed to do all the odd ones) of Shades of Green.

So if that person with the odd chapters is still around on this hellsite or anyone just literally wants half the story… message me I guess.

summary: Struck by Night (3/??)
title: Struck by Night (3/??)
body:
Summary: Fate has a funny way of pulling people together. Whether or not that’s a good thing, only time will tell.

A/N: this is genuinely so much fun to write and I’m really excited about where it’s going. Hope you guys enjoy this part!!

Pairing: AvenersxReader

Word Count: 1944

Warnings: None (the reader has a meal and it’s kind of gross I guess??)

Part 2

“So, where are we going?”

“Team meeting,” Tony says. “I thought you should meet everyone since you’re going to be here for a while.”

“Okay.”

“What, not going to accuse Rogers and Barnes of coming up with this bright idea too.”

I flinch away from his harsh tone and try to recover quickly. A poor attempt to save face.

“No.” I fold my arms. “You’ve known me for barely twenty-four hours. Please don’t assume you know more about me than what I’ve shown you.” He looks at me in surprise and I mumble out, “I’m not that shallow.”

“I never said you were,” he says softly.

“Tell your tone next time. Doesn’t seem like the two of you are on the same page.” I stop in the middle of the hallway and Tony stops to look back. “Why are we bickering like an old married couple? I barely know you!”

He stares at me for a moment before throwing his hands in the air. “I don’t know!”

“This is fuckin weird!” I cry.

“I know!” he yells back.

A man I haven’t met yet pokes his head out into the hallway. “What the hell is going on out here?!”

I immediately straighten my back and shove my hands in my pockets. Tony obviously recognizes the voice and relaxes.

“Rhodey, this is (Y/N),” he says, gesturing between the two of us. “(Y/N), Rhodey.”

I watch Rhodey closely as he steps out into the hallway and shake his hand when he offers it.

“Colonel James Rhodes,” he says. “I’m guessing you’re the vampire I’ve been hearing about.”

I snort and release his hand. “News travels fast here.”

Rhodey shrugs. “It’s hard to avoid when your best friend is a huge gossip.”

“Hey!” Tony protests. “You say that like it’s a bad thing!”

Rhodey just smiles. “Everyone’s here.”

“Really? Even Lang?”

“Sam picked him up earlier. They showed up just after Peter.”

“Fantastic.” He turns to me and smiles. “You’re about to get bombarded.”

“Great,” I mutter.

Rhodey leads us into a large communal area and Tony gestures to a seat that he wants me to sit in. I nod and plop down in the tall chair and look around at everyone. No one really seems to want to make eye contact aside from Steve or Bucky, but there’s a young man and a scruffy looking guy in his thirties who keep sneaking looks when they think I can’t see them.

Steve moves to the counter just behind me, quickly drawing everyone’s attention to him.

“All of you know we have a visitor staying with us for a while,” he says, briefly touching my shoulder. “This is (Y/N). She served with Bucky and I. This time has been set aside for you all to ask her questions. She doesn’t have to answer anything she’s uncomfortable with.”

The young man I had caught looking at me earlier sheepishly raises his hand. “You don’t have to raise your hand, you know,” I tell him, doing my best to keep my voice soft and even.

He blushes but smiles regardless. “Right, sorry. Force of habit.” He clasps his hands in his lap and leans forward. “Is it true that you’re a vampire?”

I nod once. “Yes.”

His eyes light up and he grins. “Cool. Do you actually have, y’know… fangs? Do they retract like in that old show Angel?”

Someone smacks their hand to their forehead and I choke back a laugh. “Yes, I have fangs. No, they don’t retract.” I pause for a moment, brows pulling together. “You seriously think something that came out in ninety-nine is old?”

“Don’t be too hard on him. He was born in this century,” Tony says.

His comment puts me at ease and I smile. “That makes sense. Did you want to know anything else?”

“No, thanks.” He shakes his head and smiles. “I’m Peter, by the way.”

“It’s nice to meet you.”

“What do you do for food?” a sandy-haired man blurts out.

“That’s Clint,” Steve whispers.

“Well, I’ve been following your missions for a few years now. Anyone who’s dying or dead I’ll feed off of if their blood is still viable.”

“What about before that? Like during the war?”

“I was a nurse. Blood wasn’t hard to come by.”

“And before that?”

I hesitate and look to Steve and Tony before answering. “Well… I was still a nurse then so I could sneak blood away occasionally, but that wasn’t sustainable. I hung around with the vampires who turned me. A lot of them were prostitutes, so it was easy for them to stay fed. They knew the best places to find something to eat, but it wasn’t exactly the most ideal way to stay alive.”

“Meaning…?”

“They blew guys to stay fed,” Natasha says. There’s a glint of amusement in her eyes.

Everyone’s eyes lock onto either me or Natasha and I sigh. “Yeah.”

“What?” the scruffy guy blurts out.

“Well, I mean… you know what happens when a man is aroused, right?” I can see Natasha nod and grin out of the corner of my eye. “It’s basically a blood buffet when you’re face to face with it.”

Natasha cackles when practically every man’s face in the room turns green. Clint doubles over in his chair groans in sympathy pain. Tony looks like he’s about ready to bite his finger off in an attempt to stop himself from commenting.

“Maybe Tony was right about you,” Natasha says.

“Well, I’m glad you’ve come around,” I smirk at her and she smiles.

The scruffy guy speaks up again saying, “Wait, wait, wait. How could none of that be reported? Guys getting their dicks bit had to have been something that caused complaints!”

“What’s your name again?” I ask.

He scratches the back of his neck. “I’m Scott.”

“Well, Scott, it’s a good question. The thing is, the bite itself doesn’t have to be painful. In the right situation, it can be pleasurable. If that’s something that the vampire wishes, then the victim will get the pleasure they’re expecting from the… act.”

“And the, erm… bite marks?”

“Vampire blood has healing properties.”

Scott’s face scrunches up and he shakes his head. “I don’t even wanna know.”

“Your loss.”

“When were you born?” a young woman with mousy brown hair asks.

“1917.”

“So you’re older than Rogers,” Tony says.

I nod. “But not Bucky. We’re about the same age.”

Bucky catches my eye and I raise my eyebrows at him.

“Why did you join the army?” he asks.

“There wasn’t any way for me to help at home. If I left, I’d be able to make a difference.”

He nods, satisfied with my answer. The faint beginnings of a smile tug at the corners of his mouth.

There’s a stretch of silence and Peter raises his hand again.

“Yes, Peter?”

He drops his hand back to his lap. “Do you still eat human food? Or does it taste weird now?”

“It’s not something that I seek out, but there are times when I’m tempted by a pastry or something. It’s usually something from when I was younger.”’

“To a degree, but there’s no nutritional value for me.”

“Do you digest blood?”

“Not exactly. It’s… it’s more like my body takes the blood apart and absorbs it, but there’s nothing left over after that.”

His mouth quirks up in a half smile. “Weird.”

“Very.” I wobble slightly in my seat and grab onto the lip of the chair to steady myself.

“(Y/N),” Steve places a hand on my shoulder. “What’s wrong?”

I shake my head. “I’m fine. Just haven’t eaten in a while.”

“How long is a while?”

“Five months. Maybe a couple weeks more.” Another wave of dizziness washes over me and I laugh shakily. “I was interrupted during my last meal.”

His hand tightens on my shoulder. “Do we have any blood on hand?” he asks someone across the room.

“Not much,” a voice I can’t place answers. “But we can spare a few liters.”

“Come on,” Steve helps me out of the chair and guides me out of the room.

The temperature changes as soon as we’re in the hallway and I can hear a few other sets of footsteps following after us. It’s tempting to check on who’s behind us, but my growing nausea forces me to keep my eyes trained on the floor.

The doors to the lab slide open with a hiss and Steve leads me inside. He hands me off to someone else in order to search for the promised blood.

“I’m fine, I promise,” I say, my speech slightly slurred. “That’s not how I wanted that to come out.”

“You’re not fine,” Tony says. His voice sounds so close. When I catch sight of him out of the corner of my eye his arm tightens around me.

“Can I sit down?” I ask.

Tony hooks his foot around the leg of a nearby stool and pulls it over. His hands hover near my shoulders, prepared to catch me, as I lower myself onto the seat. Tony leans on the table behind me when he’s sure I won’t fall.

“I’m sorry,” I say softly.

“What for?” Tony asks.

I shake my head. “For all of this trouble. I thought I’d be fine for another week before I absolutely needed to eat again.”

He frowns. “Seriously? You needing to eat is not trouble. You should have told us about needing blood, though.”

Steve comes over holding two blood bags. “How do you want to do this?”

I hold out one hand and Steve hands me one of the bags. I rip one corner off the bag using my teeth and ignore the looks of disgust as I squeeze the blood into my mouth like a gogurt. It’s gone too fast and I reach out and take the other bag from Steve and do the same to that one. Although I’m trying my best to eat without making a mess, can still feel some blood dribbling down my chin. When I finish with the second bag, I go back over both of them and squeeze any remaining drops into my mouth. I wipe the blood from my chin and sit quietly, allowing my stomach to settle. The room slowly stops spinning.

“Are you…” Steve hesitantly inches closer. “Better?”

“I’ll be alright for a few days, but after that, I’ll need to hunt.” I hear Tony sigh behind me. “Bet you’re wishing you’d thought a little longer about having a pet vampire now, huh?”

Steve frowns and shakes his head. “It’s just a matter of figuring out how and where you can get the blood you need.”

“There is that faction in Pennsylvania,” Bucky says.

“The one on the water?”

Bucky nods. “There’s evidence of human experimentation. You’ve got everything you need to justify a raid.”

“Am I allowed to make a suggestion?” I ask.

“Of course,” Tony says.

“If we take IVs and blood bags, I could take blood from any Hydra agents that are healthy enough. I’d be able to put away enough blood so that we’d be able to come up with a sustainable long-term plan before the supply ran out.”

“That’s… that’s really smart,” a man I can now identify as Dr. Banner says. “If you’re fully fed, how long before you’ll need to eat again?”

I shake my head and shrug. “Two months at the very least.”

“So when do we want to do this?” Steve asks.

“I’ll put an order in for everything we’ll need tonight,” Tony says. “We’ll leave tomorrow evening. Better brief your team, Cap.”

——-

Part 4

Thank you guys so much for reading! If you liked this installment, please leave a response or shoot me an ask! Feedback would be greatly appreciated!

“All of you know we have a visitor staying with us for a while,” he says, briefly touching my shoulder. “This is (Y/N). She served with Bucky and I. This time has been set aside for you all to ask her questions. She doesn’t have to answer anything she’s uncomfortable with.”

The young man I had caught looking at me earlier sheepishly raises his hand. “You don’t have to raise your hand, you know,” I tell him, doing my best to keep my voice soft and even.

He blushes but smiles regardless. “Right, sorry. Force of habit.” He clasps his hands in his lap and leans forward. “Is it true that you’re a vampire?”

I nod once. “Yes.”

His eyes light up and he grins. “Cool. Do you actually have, y’know… fangs? Do they retract like in that old show Angel?”

Someone smacks their hand to their forehead and I choke back a laugh. “Yes, I have fangs. No, they don’t retract.” I pause for a moment, brows pulling together. “You seriously think something that came out in ninety-nine is old?”

“Don’t be too hard on him. He was born in this century,” Tony says.

His comment puts me at ease and I smile. “That makes sense. Did you want to know anything else?”

“No, thanks.” He shakes his head and smiles. “I’m Peter, by the way.”

“It’s nice to meet you.”

“What do you do for food?” a sandy-haired man blurts out.

“That’s Clint,” Steve whispers.

“Well, I’ve been following your missions for a few years now. Anyone who’s dying or dead I’ll feed off of if their blood is still viable.”

“What about before that? Like during the war?”

“I was a nurse. Blood wasn’t hard to come by.”

“And before that?”

I hesitate and look to Steve and Tony before answering. “Well… I was still a nurse then so I could sneak blood away occasionally, but that wasn’t sustainable. I hung around with the vampires who turned me. A lot of them were prostitutes, so it was easy for them to stay fed. They knew the best places to find something to eat, but it wasn’t exactly the most ideal way to stay alive.”

“Meaning…?”

“They blew guys to stay fed,” Natasha says. There’s a glint of amusement in her eyes.

Everyone’s eyes lock onto either me or Natasha and I sigh. “Yeah.”

“What?” the scruffy guy blurts out.

“Well, I mean… you know what happens when a man is aroused, right?” I can see Natasha nod and grin out of the corner of my eye. “It’s basically a blood buffet when you’re face to face with it.”

Natasha cackles when practically every man’s face in the room turns green. Clint doubles over in his chair groans in sympathy pain. Tony looks like he’s about ready to bite his finger off in an attempt to stop himself from commenting.

“Maybe Tony was right about you,” Natasha says.

“Well, I’m glad you’ve come around,” I smirk at her and she smiles.

The scruffy guy speaks up again saying, “Wait, wait, wait. How could none of that be reported? Guys getting their dicks bit had to have been something that caused complaints!”

“What’s your name again?” I ask.

He scratches the back of his neck. “I’m Scott.”

“Well, Scott, it’s a good question. The thing is, the bite itself doesn’t have to be painful. In the right situation, it can be pleasurable. If that’s something that the vampire wishes, then the victim will get the pleasure they’re expecting from the… act.”

“And the, erm… bite marks?”

“Vampire blood has healing properties.”

Scott’s face scrunches up and he shakes his head. “I don’t even wanna know.”

“Your loss.”

“When were you born?” a young woman with mousy brown hair asks.

“1917.”

“So you’re older than Rogers,” Tony says.

I nod. “But not Bucky. We’re about the same age.”

Bucky catches my eye and I raise my eyebrows at him.

“Why did you join the army?” he asks.

“There wasn’t any way for me to help at home. If I left, I’d be able to make a difference.”

He nods, satisfied with my answer. The faint beginnings of a smile tug at the corners of his mouth.

There’s a stretch of silence and Peter raises his hand again.

“Yes, Peter?”

He drops his hand back to his lap. “Do you still eat human food? Or does it taste weird now?”

“It’s not something that I seek out, but there are times when I’m tempted by a pastry or something. It’s usually something from when I was younger.”’

“To a degree, but there’s no nutritional value for me.”

“Do you digest blood?”

“Not exactly. It’s… it’s more like my body takes the blood apart and absorbs it, but there’s nothing left over after that.”

His mouth quirks up in a half smile. “Weird.”

“Very.” I wobble slightly in my seat and grab onto the lip of the chair to steady myself.

“(Y/N),” Steve places a hand on my shoulder. “What’s wrong?”

I shake my head. “I’m fine. Just haven’t eaten in a while.”

“How long is a while?”

“Five months. Maybe a couple weeks more.” Another wave of dizziness washes over me and I laugh shakily. “I was interrupted during my last meal.”

His hand tightens on my shoulder. “Do we have any blood on hand?” he asks someone across the room.

“Not much,” a voice I can’t place answers. “But we can spare a few liters.”

“Come on,” Steve helps me out of the chair and guides me out of the room.

The temperature changes as soon as we’re in the hallway and I can hear a few other sets of footsteps following after us. It’s tempting to check on who’s behind us, but my growing nausea forces me to keep my eyes trained on the floor.

The doors to the lab slide open with a hiss and Steve leads me inside. He hands me off to someone else in order to search for the promised blood.

“I’m fine, I promise,” I say, my speech slightly slurred. “That’s not how I wanted that to come out.”

“You’re not fine,” Tony says. His voice sounds so close. When I catch sight of him out of the corner of my eye his arm tightens around me.

“Can I sit down?” I ask.

Tony hooks his foot around the leg of a nearby stool and pulls it over. His hands hover near my shoulders, prepared to catch me, as I lower myself onto the seat. Tony leans on the table behind me when he’s sure I won’t fall.

“I’m sorry,” I say softly.

“What for?” Tony asks.

I shake my head. “For all of this trouble. I thought I’d be fine for another week before I absolutely needed to eat again.”

He frowns. “Seriously? You needing to eat is not trouble. You should have told us about needing blood, though.”

Steve comes over holding two blood bags. “How do you want to do this?”

I hold out one hand and Steve hands me one of the bags. I rip one corner off the bag using my teeth and ignore the looks of disgust as I squeeze the blood into my mouth like a gogurt. It’s gone too fast and I reach out and take the other bag from Steve and do the same to that one. Although I’m trying my best to eat without making a mess, can still feel some blood dribbling down my chin. When I finish with the second bag, I go back over both of them and squeeze any remaining drops into my mouth. I wipe the blood from my chin and sit quietly, allowing my stomach to settle. The room slowly stops spinning.

“Are you…” Steve hesitantly inches closer. “Better?”

“I’ll be alright for a few days, but after that, I’ll need to hunt.” I hear Tony sigh behind me. “Bet you’re wishing you’d thought a little longer about having a pet vampire now, huh?”

Steve frowns and shakes his head. “It’s just a matter of figuring out how and where you can get the blood you need.”

“There is that faction in Pennsylvania,” Bucky says.

“The one on the water?”

Bucky nods. “There’s evidence of human experimentation. You’ve got everything you need to justify a raid.”

“Am I allowed to make a suggestion?” I ask.

“Of course,” Tony says.

“If we take IVs and blood bags, I could take blood from any Hydra agents that are healthy enough. I’d be able to put away enough blood so that we’d be able to come up with a sustainable long-term plan before the supply ran out.”

“That’s… that’s really smart,” a man I can now identify as Dr. Banner says. “If you’re fully fed, how long before you’ll need to eat again?”

I shake my head and shrug. “Two months at the very least.”

“So when do we want to do this?” Steve asks.

“I’ll put an order in for everything we’ll need tonight,” Tony says. “We’ll leave tomorrow evening. Better brief your team, Cap.”

——-

Part 4

“Well, I’ve been following your missions for a few years now. Anyone who’s dying or dead I’ll feed off of if their blood is still viable.”

“What about before that? Like during the war?”

“I was a nurse. Blood wasn’t hard to come by.”

“And before that?”

I hesitate and look to Steve and Tony before answering. “Well… I was still a nurse then so I could sneak blood away occasionally, but that wasn’t sustainable. I hung around with the vampires who turned me. A lot of them were prostitutes, so it was easy for them to stay fed. They knew the best places to find something to eat, but it wasn’t exactly the most ideal way to stay alive.”

“Meaning…?”

“They blew guys to stay fed,” Natasha says. There’s a glint of amusement in her eyes.

Everyone’s eyes lock onto either me or Natasha and I sigh. “Yeah.”

“What?” the scruffy guy blurts out.

“Well, I mean… you know what happens when a man is aroused, right?” I can see Natasha nod and grin out of the corner of my eye. “It’s basically a blood buffet when you’re face to face with it.”

Natasha cackles when practically every man’s face in the room turns green. Clint doubles over in his chair groans in sympathy pain. Tony looks like he’s about ready to bite his finger off in an attempt to stop himself from commenting.

“Maybe Tony was right about you,” Natasha says.

“Well, I’m glad you’ve come around,” I smirk at her and she smiles.

The scruffy guy speaks up again saying, “Wait, wait, wait. How could none of that be reported? Guys getting their dicks bit had to have been something that caused complaints!”

“What’s your name again?” I ask.

He scratches the back of his neck. “I’m Scott.”

“Well, Scott, it’s a good question. The thing is, the bite itself doesn’t have to be painful. In the right situation, it can be pleasurable. If that’s something that the vampire wishes, then the victim will get the pleasure they’re expecting from the… act.”

“And the, erm… bite marks?”

“Vampire blood has healing properties.”

Scott’s face scrunches up and he shakes his head. “I don’t even wanna know.”

“Your loss.”

“When were you born?” a young woman with mousy brown hair asks.

“1917.”

“So you’re older than Rogers,” Tony says.

I nod. “But not Bucky. We’re about the same age.”

Bucky catches my eye and I raise my eyebrows at him.

“Why did you join the army?” he asks.

“There wasn’t any way for me to help at home. If I left, I’d be able to make a difference.”

He nods, satisfied with my answer. The faint beginnings of a smile tug at the corners of his mouth.

There’s a stretch of silence and Peter raises his hand again.

“Yes, Peter?”

He drops his hand back to his lap. “Do you still eat human food? Or does it taste weird now?”

“It’s not something that I seek out, but there are times when I’m tempted by a pastry or something. It’s usually something from when I was younger.”’

“To a degree, but there’s no nutritional value for me.”

“Do you digest blood?”

“Not exactly. It’s… it’s more like my body takes the blood apart and absorbs it, but there’s nothing left over after that.”

His mouth quirks up in a half smile. “Weird.”

“Very.” I wobble slightly in my seat and grab onto the lip of the chair to steady myself.

“(Y/N),” Steve places a hand on my shoulder. “What’s wrong?”

I shake my head. “I’m fine. Just haven’t eaten in a while.”

“How long is a while?”

“Five months. Maybe a couple weeks more.” Another wave of dizziness washes over me and I laugh shakily. “I was interrupted during my last meal.”

His hand tightens on my shoulder. “Do we have any blood on hand?” he asks someone across the room.

“Not much,” a voice I can’t place answers. “But we can spare a few liters.”

“Come on,” Steve helps me out of the chair and guides me out of the room.

The temperature changes as soon as we’re in the hallway and I can hear a few other sets of footsteps following after us. It’s tempting to check on who’s behind us, but my growing nausea forces me to keep my eyes trained on the floor.

The doors to the lab slide open with a hiss and Steve leads me inside. He hands me off to someone else in order to search for the promised blood.

“I’m fine, I promise,” I say, my speech slightly slurred. “That’s not how I wanted that to come out.”

“You’re not fine,” Tony says. His voice sounds so close. When I catch sight of him out of the corner of my eye his arm tightens around me.

“Can I sit down?” I ask.

Tony hooks his foot around the leg of a nearby stool and pulls it over. His hands hover near my shoulders, prepared to catch me, as I lower myself onto the seat. Tony leans on the table behind me when he’s sure I won’t fall.

“I’m sorry,” I say softly.

“What for?” Tony asks.

I shake my head. “For all of this trouble. I thought I’d be fine for another week before I absolutely needed to eat again.”

He frowns. “Seriously? You needing to eat is not trouble. You should have told us about needing blood, though.”

Steve comes over holding two blood bags. “How do you want to do this?”

I hold out one hand and Steve hands me one of the bags. I rip one corner off the bag using my teeth and ignore the looks of disgust as I squeeze the blood into my mouth like a gogurt. It’s gone too fast and I reach out and take the other bag from Steve and do the same to that one. Although I’m trying my best to eat without making a mess, can still feel some blood dribbling down my chin. When I finish with the second bag, I go back over both of them and squeeze any remaining drops into my mouth. I wipe the blood from my chin and sit quietly, allowing my stomach to settle. The room slowly stops spinning.

“Are you…” Steve hesitantly inches closer. “Better?”

“I’ll be alright for a few days, but after that, I’ll need to hunt.” I hear Tony sigh behind me. “Bet you’re wishing you’d thought a little longer about having a pet vampire now, huh?”

Steve frowns and shakes his head. “It’s just a matter of figuring out how and where you can get the blood you need.”

“There is that faction in Pennsylvania,” Bucky says.

“The one on the water?”

Bucky nods. “There’s evidence of human experimentation. You’ve got everything you need to justify a raid.”

“Am I allowed to make a suggestion?” I ask.

“Of course,” Tony says.

“If we take IVs and blood bags, I could take blood from any Hydra agents that are healthy enough. I’d be able to put away enough blood so that we’d be able to come up with a sustainable long-term plan before the supply ran out.”

“That’s… that’s really smart,” a man I can now identify as Dr. Banner says. “If you’re fully fed, how long before you’ll need to eat again?”

I shake my head and shrug. “Two months at the very least.”

“So when do we want to do this?” Steve asks.

“I’ll put an order in for everything we’ll need tonight,” Tony says. “We’ll leave tomorrow evening. Better brief your team, Cap.”

——-

Part 4

Thank you guys so much for reading! If you liked this installment, please leave a response or shoot me an ask! Feedback would be greatly appreciated!

Summary: Fate has a funny way of pulling people together. Whether or not that’s a good thing, only time will tell.

A/N: this is genuinely so much fun to write and I’m really excited about where it’s going. Hope you guys enjoy this part!!

Pairing: AvenersxReader

Word Count: 1944

Warnings: None (the reader has a meal and it’s kind of gross I guess??)

Part 2

“So, where are we going?”

“Team meeting,” Tony says. “I thought you should meet everyone since you’re going to be here for a while.”

“Okay.”

“What, not going to accuse Rogers and Barnes of coming up with this bright idea too.”

I flinch away from his harsh tone and try to recover quickly. A poor attempt to save face.

“No.” I fold my arms. “You’ve known me for barely twenty-four hours. Please don’t assume you know more about me than what I’ve shown you.” He looks at me in surprise and I mumble out, “I’m not that shallow.”

“I never said you were,” he says softly.

“Tell your tone next time. Doesn’t seem like the two of you are on the same page.” I stop in the middle of the hallway and Tony stops to look back. “Why are we bickering like an old married couple? I barely know you!”

He stares at me for a moment before throwing his hands in the air. “I don’t know!”

“This is fuckin weird!” I cry.

“I know!” he yells back.

summary: Ironstrange Kisses #9 - Because of a Promise
title: Ironstrange Kisses #9 - Because of a Promise
body:
“I promise that I’ll be careful next time,” Stephen promises. He’s been in bed for half a week, recovering from what happened. Tony was not even sure, frankly, what happened to him, because Stephen has been reticent, unable to speak those words. Still, he is able to make promises. “I misjudged the dimension. I was not aware what would…occur.”

“You could have been killed,” Tony murmurs , sitting down on the end of the bed. He knows he’d be a mighty hypocrite for judging, but he’s judging hard. Fear has him on edge. “You take too many risks…”

Stephen tuts and raises an eyebrow and Tony can read the gesture as a ‘really?’

“I have to do what I must do, Tony,” Stephen says, reaching over. Tony scoots so he’s practically on top of his poor sorcerer. “It is a duty that I have to protect this realm… Surely, you of all people understand that.”

“Just promise you’ll try to be safe.”

Stephen sighs and tugs him into a kiss.

“I promise.”
